intro: Diodia vaginalis, commonly known as swamp mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland habitats, including swamps and marshes. The plant features alternate, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton.
